author: sky.cactus
content: It is a common scam to utilize the about section of ones profile to add things like "support" and "moderator" and "help desk" to trick users into thinking the person has some official role within the community.

author: ashhh26.
content: Do anyone have idea about forking the BSC ?

author: trent_vanepps
content: Yes, but I need a screenshot of them dming at least. Canâ€™t just ban people randomly

author: sky.cactus
content: I can appreciate your hesitancy.  All I can say is that my team bans probably 100s of accounts per day that do this type of scam and we have become proactive about it because it is so common.

author: sky.cactus
content: It is certainly possible that there is some legitimate user that thought putting `ADMINISTRATOR` in their Discord "about me" section was a reasonable non-scammy thing to do, but we also *know* that there are bots out there that do this *exact* thing in droves every day to scam people.

author: sky.cactus
content: I weigh it around 99.95% chance this is a scammer based on that about me, just based on my personal experience.

author: sky.cactus
content: Another similar common scam is to name the account "Help Desk" or "Support" or "Administrator" or Moderator".  I think they shifted away from this because that is *really* easy to notice and auto-ban with a bot, so they switched to putting that in the about me section of Discord because that is harder to automatically detect/notice.
